overview: The Azure Local Hybrid Cloud Architecture integrates on-premises resources with Azure services, providing a robust platform for both traditional and containerized applications while leveraging Azure's management and security capabilities.

components.name: Control Plane
components.description: Central management interface for Azure services including backup, monitoring, and security.
security_considerations: Access to the control plane must be restricted to authorized personnel only.
Multi-factor authentication (MFA) should be enforced for all access.
components.data_handling: Manages configurations and policies for local and Azure resources.
components.encryption_status: Data in transit is encrypted using TLS.
vulnerabilities: Potential for unauthorized access if credentials are compromised.

components.name: Azure Local Instance
components.description: Hosts traditional non-containerized applications and virtual machines managed through Hyper-V.
security_considerations: Regular patch management for the Hyper-V host and guest VMs.
Isolation of VMs to prevent lateral movement in case of a breach.
components.authorization_model: Local user permissions and AAD integration.
components.encryption_status: Data at rest is encrypted using BitLocker.
vulnerabilities: VM escape attacks if not properly secured.

components.name: Kubernetes-based Applications
components.description: Supports containerized workloads via Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) enabled by Azure Arc.
security_considerations: Implement network policies to restrict pod communication.
Use Azure Policy for Kubernetes to enforce security standards.
components.encryption_status: Secrets stored in Kubernetes are encrypted at rest.
vulnerabilities: Misconfigured RBAC leading to privilege escalation.

components.name: Validated Hardware
components.description: Physical infrastructure consisting of Azure Local machines connected through ToR switches.
security_considerations: Physical security controls to prevent unauthorized access.
Ensure firmware is up to date to mitigate hardware vulnerabilities.
vulnerabilities: Physical tampering if security is lax.

components.name: Corporate Firewall
components.description: Manages outbound access and secures the network.
security_considerations: Regularly update firewall rules to reflect current security policies.
components.data_handling: Controls all network traffic to and from the local environment.

security_risks: Data leakage if encryption is not enforced.
Exposure of secrets if access controls are misconfigured.

trust_boundaries.name: On-Premises Network
recommendations: Implement strict access controls and monitoring.
Regular security audits and penetration testing.

trust_boundaries.name: Cloud Environment
security_controls: Encryption at rest and in transit
recommendations: Enforce strong password policies and MFA.
Regularly review and update service configurations.
